skill.name: recipe-manager
skill.description: Helps add, edit, validate, and manage recipe data in recipes.js. Use this when the user wants to create new recipes, modify existing ones, fix recipe formatting, or validate recipe structure.
skill.summary: Manages recipe data in recipes.js with schema validation and formatting tools
skill.author: AdamFehse

security_audit.summary: All static findings are false positives. The SKILL.md file contains documentation with JavaScript code examples for recipe management. Backtick patterns are markdown code fences, not shell execution. No actual filesystem access, network requests, or command execution occurs. This is a benign documentation skill for recipe data management.

content.user_title: Add and manage recipes in recipes.js
content.value_statement: Managing recipe data manually is error-prone and inconsistent. This skill provides a structured approach to adding, editing, and validating recipes in a standardized JavaScript format.
actual_capabilities: Add new recipes to recipes.js following the structured schema
Edit existing recipes with proper formatting and validation
Convert recipe formats from strings to structured objects
Validate recipe data against the defined schema
Scale ingredient quantities with consistent formatting
Group ingredients into logical component sections
limitations: Operates only on recipes.js file, not other data sources
Does not execute or test recipes, only manages data
Cannot fetch recipes from external websites or APIs
Does not handle images or media files directly

use_cases.title: Add a new recipe
use_cases.description: Create a new recipe entry with proper structure, ingredients, and instructions following the established schema patterns.
use_cases.target_user: Home cooks expanding their digital recipe collection

use_cases.title: Convert legacy recipe format
use_cases.description: Transform old string-based ingredient formats into structured objects with amount, unit, ingredient, and prep fields.
use_cases.target_user: Users migrating from older recipe formats

use_cases.title: Validate recipe data
use_cases.description: Check existing recipes for missing fields, incorrect categories, syntax errors, and compliance with the schema.

prompt_templates.title: Simple recipe addition
prompt_templates.prompt: Add a new recipe for [dish name] to recipes.js. Use the object format with name, category (Entree, Side, Soup, or Dessert), components, instructions, and notes fields.
prompt_templates.scenario: When a user wants to add a single recipe with all required fields

prompt_templates.title: Batch conversion
prompt_templates.prompt: Convert these [N] ingredients from string format to structured object format with amount, unit, ingredient, and prep fields: [paste ingredients]
prompt_templates.scenario: When converting multiple ingredients from text to structured format

prompt_templates.title: Recipe validation
prompt_templates.prompt: Validate the recipe at slug [recipe-slug] in recipes.js. Check for missing fields, correct category, valid ingredients, proper syntax, and schema compliance.
prompt_templates.scenario: When checking an existing recipe for errors

prompt_templates.title: Category bulk update
prompt_templates.prompt: Move the recipe [recipe-slug] from [old-category] to [new-category] and ensure the data structure follows the current schema requirements.

output_examples.input: Add a recipe for classic beef stroganoff with egg noodles

output: Ingredients: All objects have amount, unit, ingredient

best_practices: Use kebab-case for recipe slugs (lowercase with hyphens)
Group related ingredients into logical components like 'Dough', 'Sauce', 'Topping'
Include preparation notes in the prep field when ingredients need preprocessing
anti_patterns: Using empty strings for required fields like unit or ingredient
Skipping the category field or using non-standard categories
Leaving trailing commas in JavaScript objects or arrays

faq.question: What file does this skill modify?
faq.answer: This skill works with recipes.js, a JavaScript file that exports recipe objects as a global window.RECIPES object.

faq.question: What categories are supported?
faq.answer: Recipes must use one of four categories: Entree, Side, Soup, or Dessert. This order also determines display order.

faq.question: How do I format ingredient amounts?
faq.answer: Use numbers for decimals (0.5) or fraction strings ('1/2', '1/4', '1/3'). The skill can parse and scale both formats.

faq.question: Can I add notes to recipes?
faq.answer: Yes, the notes field accepts either a single string or an array of strings. Each array item renders as a separate paragraph.

faq.question: How do I handle recipes with multiple parts?
faq.answer: Use the components object to group ingredients. Common patterns include 'Dough', 'Filling', 'Topping' or 'Base', 'Sauce', 'Garnish'.

faq.question: What validation checks are performed?
faq.answer: The skill checks for valid categories, required fields, proper ingredient structure, valid URLs in images, and correct JavaScript syntax.
